meanings.definition: A person who travels frequently and enjoys exploring new places.
meanings.sent1: The gypster packed their backpack and set off on another adventure.
meanings.sent2: She met a friendly gypster at the hostel who shared stories of their travels.
meanings.sent3: The gypster accidentally boarded the wrong bus and ended up in a quirky little town.
meanings.sent4: Her free spirit made her a true gypster, always seeking new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The colorful map on the wall marked the gypster's journey across continents.

meanings.definition: To travel in a spontaneous and adventurous manner.
meanings.sent1: Let's gypster our way through the countryside, stopping wherever we please.
meanings.sent2: They decided to gypster around Europe without a set itinerary.
meanings.sent3: He gypstered his way through the bustling city, stumbling upon hidden gems.
meanings.sent4: The river gypstered through the valley, carving its own path.
meanings.sent5: The wind gypstered through the trees, rustling the leaves in its wake.

meanings.definition: A style or trend characterized by a mix of bohemian and gypsy influences.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit combined elements of bohemian and gypsy styles, creating a unique gypster look.
meanings.sent2: The new boutique in town featured a collection of gypster clothing and accessories.
meanings.sent3: The gypster trend brought a colorful and eclectic vibe to the fashion scene.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated in a gypster theme, with vibrant colors and flowing fabrics.
meanings.sent5: She embraced the gypster aesthetic, wearing layers of scarves and bold jewelry.
